page.title: 04LIFE STYLE IN CHURCH STREET
page.content: The life style of the people living in {Church Street}has several aspects. Some of the inhabitants of this peaceful part of North Kent commute to towns for employment whilst others are employed on local farms. They need to travel only two kilometres south, to the village of Higham, to attend Junior School, join in varied village activities,including Age Concern,Mothers and Toddlers Club, shopping etc. Conversely,if they proceed in a northerly direction, towards the{River Thames},they can enjoy walking and sailing. They are proud that their hamlet has been in existence for over one thousand years. An entry in the original{Domesday Book established the presence of a church here. The houses are varied; some thatched but the majority are modern,brick-built houses.
